decks.notes: This deck focuses on casting powerful Eldrazi creatures early in the game and disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Tidehollow Sculler. The deck also includes removal spells like Path to Exile, Fatal Push, and Dismember to control the board. Additionally, the deck utilizes Lingering Souls for additional pressure and Relic of Progenitus for graveyard hate. The deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing graveyard interactions to quickly fill the board with creatures like Prized Amalgam, Narcomoeba, and Bloodghast. By using cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion to discard cards and dredge Life from the Loam, the deck can easily bring back creatures from the graveyard and overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence. Conflagrate can then be used to finish off the opponent or clear the board if needed. The deck aims to quickly set up its engine and win the game before the opponent has a chance to counteract it.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play Death's Shadow as a powerful threat early in the game, supported by cards like Snapcaster Mage, Gurmag Angler, and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push, Terminate, and Lightning Bolt, while disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also utilizes cantrips like Serum Visions and Thought Scour to filter through the deck and find key cards. Additionally, Stubborn Denial provides counter magic to protect key threats.

The deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing Eldrazi temples and colorless mana sources like Urza's lands, the deck aims to cast powerful creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer early in the game. Chalice of the Void helps disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Dismember provide removal options. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Emrakul, the Promised End to secure victory. Overall, the deck is designed to apply pressure and close out games quickly.

The deck revolves around utilizing cards such as Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace to draw your entire deck, then win the game using Lightning Storm. The deck focuses on ramping mana quickly with cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism, while also protecting yourself with Phyrexian Unlife and Pact of Negation. The goal is to set up and execute a powerful combo quickly to defeat your opponent before they have a chance to counter your strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling a board full of artifact creatures and equipment to overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. By combining cards that generate mana, boost creatures' power and toughness, and provide card advantage, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and win the game quickly before they have a chance to stabilize. The synergy between creatures, equipment, and support cards like Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager allows for explosive plays and powerful attacks. It is a fast-paced and aggressive strategy that aims to win the game through speed and resilience.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and counterspells. It also utilizes card advantage and value generation through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Painful Truths. The deck can also apply pressure with creatures like Glory-Bound Initiate and Lingering Souls. The mana base is built around producing the necessary colors for spells and lands that can provide additional utility. Overall, the deck aims to control the game, outvalue the opponent, and secure victory through a combination of disruption and threats.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Spell Queller and Snapcaster Mage while maintaining its own board presence with Celestial Colonnade. By utilizing cards like Path to Exile, Lightning Helix, and Cryptic Command, the deck can control the tempo of the game and eventually outvalue the opponent. The mana base is designed to support a variety of spells and ensure consistent access to all colors.

This deck focuses on assembling a combo with Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, allowing you to dig through your deck with Duskwatch Recruiter and tutor for the necessary pieces with Chord of Calling. It also utilizes toolbox creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Eternal Witness to maintain board control and recur key cards. Magus of the Moon disrupts opponents' mana bases, while cards like Rhonas the Indomitable and Walking Ballista provide alternate win conditions. The deck aims to be versatile and adaptable in various matchups.

The main concept of this Aggro-Death's Shadow deck is to quickly lower your own life total to grow Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler while disrupting your opponent's game plan with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial. Use cards like Street Wraith and Thought Scour to quickly draw into your threats and protect them with removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate. Utilize Snapcaster Mage to flashback key spells and close out the game with powerful finishers like Temur Battle Rage. Balancing aggression with disruption is key to success with this deck.

This deck focuses on ramping up quickly using Urza's lands and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. It also includes control elements like Chalice of the Void and Dismember to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive creatures while maintaining board control with cards like Walking Ballista and Endbringer. Emrakul, the Promised End and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger provide powerful finishers to close out the game.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive Eldrazi creatures and controlling the board with powerful colorless spells. The deck is designed to quickly ramp up mana to play big threats like Emrakul and Ulamog while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Dismember. The Eldrazi's ability to generate fast, large creatures can overwhelm opponents before they have a chance to stabilize, making it a formidable force in the Modern format. The deck's consistency and power level make it a strong contender in 1 vs 1 matchups.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek while putting pressure on the board with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Grim Flayer. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Path to Exile and Abrupt Decay to deal with opposing threats. Additionally, the deck features cards that provide card advantage like Dark Confidant and Lingering Souls to keep the pressure on the opponent. The mana base is well balanced to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

This deck aims to assemble a powerful combo using Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, allowing for an explosive play with Walking Ballista or Chord of Calling. The deck also utilizes Collected Company and Chord of Calling to find key pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Kitchen Finks and Eternal Witness provide resilience and value, while Duskwatch Recruiter helps to find important pieces. The deck's toolbox of creatures allows for flexibility in different matchups, making it a versatile and potent choice in Modern 1 vs 1 gameplay.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up your mana using cards like Farseek and Sakura-Tribe Elder to get to seven lands as fast as possible, then play Scapeshift or Primeval Titan to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and a bunch of Mountains to deal a ton of damage to your opponent in one go. Madcap Experiment and Platinum Emperion can help protect you from damage while you set up your win condition. The deck aims to combo off and win in a single turn before your opponent can react.

The key concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Farseek, Explore, and Sakura-Tribe Elder, to cast a powerful combo with Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. By sacrificing lands and searching for more Mountain cards, the player can deal massive amounts of damage to their opponent in one turn. Primeval Titan helps search for Valakut or additional Mountains, while Lightning Bolt and Anger of the Gods provide removal and board control. The deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn through clever land manipulation and combo synergy.
